headline: Almost No Fat Banana Bread
description: This banana bread with applesauce and egg whites is low in fat yet still deliciously tender and moist. Cinnamon adds a subtle spiced flavor.
name: Almost No Fat Banana Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease an 8x4-inch loaf pan.
Stir flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and cinnamon together in a large bowl. Add banana, applesauce, and egg whites; stir just until combined. Pour batter into the prepared pan.
Bake in preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 50 to 55 minutes. Turn out onto a wire rack and allow to cool before slicing.

review.reviewBody: Being relatively new to low-fat cooking, I was pleasantly surprised with the outcome for this recipe.

4.5 if I could becuase Like others said it has a little rubbery texture but still tastes great! I added 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and a teaspoon of vanilla. Alsoi sprinkled brown sugar and cinnamon on top for a nice sweet crust. My kids loved it which is a plus. They added whipped cream on top. I am always looking for low to no fat recipes becuase I have gallstones and can't have fat.

I really enjoy Banana Bread but sometimes they can be heavy and full of yummy calories. I love this recipe and will make it again. I used 1/2 cup of sugar, added nutmeg and cinnamon (just a dash) I added salt as well along with vanilla and Almond Extract. Disappointedly I didn't have walnuts but used pecans instead. It was/is delicious! I LOVE THIS RECIPE! Tip: Don't overmix the wet ingredients that will make your crust rubbery.

It turned out great! I added 1/2 tsp salt and 1 tsp vanilla. I mixed the dry ingredients separately from the wet ingredients then stirred them together just until combined to keep the bread from being tough.

I used the Splenda brown sugar baking blend instead of regular white sugar, and added a splash of vanilla extract. It came out delicious, with way less carbs and essentially no fat. My 8 year old even begged me to make it again the next day!
This recipe is amazing as-is!! I was overwhelmed with all the adjustments people made in the reviews so I just trusted the recipe and it was delicious.

Since my bananas were very ripe, I omitted the sugar entirely. I also only used one whole egg rather than two egg whites. I used my baked donut pan to make 12 baked items. These are great popped into the toaster on a low setting to get them warm for a breakfast item with my coffee in the morning. Even with the addition of a 1/4 cup of dark chocolate chips to the recipe, the calorie content for each donut is 106.

The best banana bread!!! We loved it and so did our (socially distanced) friends! I doubled everything, used two whole eggs instead of egg whites, and added walnuts, sunflower seeds, and sugar-free chocolate chips. I also used a mixture of 50/50 brown sugar and Splenda.?
I made it with the changes people suggested. I baked it for about 1hr 15 minutes. It's a very moist loaf. I thought 1/2 c sugar was still too sweet.
Great Very Yummy Good for my kid on diet
First time making this. I added a little more banana than it called for. Everyone enjoyed the bread.

Delicious, with (as many other readers mentioned) a few modifications - add 1/4 t salt, add 1/2 tsp vanilla extract, do 1/3 cup applesauce instead of 1/2, and use 3 bananas. MAJOR COMMENT is that this bread is VERY sweet with 3/4 cup sugar - if you're looking to make this for a bake sale or something where this is meant to be a treat/dessert, then I think it's fine to use it but otherwise I would definitely recommend cutting to 1/2 cup sugar (or even less).

This was SO easy to make. Per other reviewers, I subbed 1 egg for the egg white, added 1 t vanilla and 1/2 t nutmeg as well as 1/2 t salt. Mixed wet and dry ingredients separately then mixed together until just blended together, no over-mixing. This was SO delicious!!! I baked for exactly 53 minutes.

Overall this is a decent recipe. It does the job, but isn’t overwhelmingly amazing. I added nutmeg and walnuts. I also added 2 whole eggs rather than egg whites by mistake. For next time I would likely reduce the amount of sugar, possibly replace white sugar with brown and simply use 1 egg.

I made the recommended changes voiced by other reviewers: 1/2 natural applesauce, 1/4 tsp salt, added nutmeg and vanilla and craisins, 1 whole egg instead of 2 egg whites, 3 bananas, replaced sugar with Truvia, 1 cup flour and 1/2 cup WW flour. It was wonderful and moist. I never told my husband about replacing the sugar with Truvia! :-)

I loved this recipe, just making the few tweaks suggested by a lot of folks! My personal little secret, though, is cutting back on the sugar and adding a sugar-free, flavored coffee syrup (I used Jordan’s Skinny Syrups in Maple Bourbon Pecan flavor - a find at TJ MAXX - just 1-2 TBSP - 0 fat, 0 calories, 0 sugar - and it added a lot of flavor and a little moisture! So delicious! Thanks for the recipe!
It's a hit in my household!
Very easy and good.

Notes:
Made double recipe with 2 1/4 c cassava flour, substituted 1/2 c sugar with brown sugar, added 1/2 tsp salt, used 3 cups of applesauce vs. 2.

It was just ok to me - it lacked the banana flavor I was looking for (and yes, I used reallllly ripe bananas) and not as moist a little more dense than I was hoping for but for almost no fat, what did I expect lol. I might try again with an additional banana maybe.
Very dense and dry. Would not make again.

I made it into muffins. Cooked in 15 minutes. 
A few changes: 3/8 cups of almond flour; 1 1/8 cup of wheat flour; 1/2 cup of sugar (decrease); 1/2 tsp nutmeg; 3 bananas; and I increased applesauce to 1/3 cup. Added 1 tsp Mexican vanilla and 1/4 tsp salt. 

Flour was my idea the rest I got from other comments.

I’m disappointed. I made this recipe as specified, except that I added chocolate chips. The bread was bland and rubbery, as many people found. After I made the bread, I read the reviews. Many people suggested adding vanilla and salt. Not sure how you can give a recipe a good review if you have to alter its basic composition.
Because I like a spicier banana bread, I added 1/2 teaspoon of ground nutmeg, 1/2 teaspoon of ground allspice, and 1 tablespoon of vanilla extract.

I did make changes. I used oat flour and oat groats. I used two whole eggs and no baking powder. I also added pecans and cut up apricots. I also used a raw brown sugar. The applesauce gives this a very nice moist texture. With any quick bread, you can switch things up how you wish as long as you keep the dry to wet ratio the same. Am making another oat loaf now, this time with dried cranberries and pecans. Yum!
This has been my go to recipe for many years. I always double the recipe, except for the sugar which I leave as is to suit our tastes, and add walnuts. Delicious!!!
Devilishly moist and as addictive as a bag of chips.
No changes. It is DELICIOUS! AND MOIST!

PERFECTION 
I have been on the hunt for a GOOD banana bread recipe forever and ive FINALLY FOUND IT!
Its EXACTLY what i want in a good banana bread! Its perfectly soft and moist, dense almost because its so moist?? But airy at the same time! Im not a fan of the overly light & airy banana breads and this one has the PERFECT texture! Its not overly sweet at all, which i was afraid of, infact i was planning on only adding 1/2c sugar, but upon reading reviews, 1/2c wouldve been not sweet enough so i used 3/4c and it was the perfect amount!
I dont see why does this recipe doesnt have 8k 5-star ratings because this recipes tops ALL the other banana breads ive tried EASILY
I used pancake and waffle mix instead of flour. I omitted the baking soda/powder because pancake mix has it already. I also used 2 whole eggs. Really good not too sweet either.

I used the ENTIRE egg (2), and used CINNAMON applesauce, AND used 1/3 C. SOUR CREAM, 1/4 C. CHOCOLATE CHIPS...
AWESOME....SUPER MOIST!!!
Yummy!
No apple sauce did low fat yogurt. Really good. Did cut back on sugar like most others.

I made this recipe, but didn't have applesauce, so I increased the amount of banana by 1/4 cup to substitute for the applesauce. I also added a cup of blueberries. I like it. I will make it again if my husband enjoys it. He is trying to transition to a low fat heart healthy diet.

Changes: 20 minutes bake NOT 50
Add vanilla and walnuts
Tastes great!

Turned out great! I added a whole egg and just before baking I sprinkled cinnamon, sugar, a tiny sprinkle of instant oats (for decoration really) and the teeniest tiniest pats of butter. Turned out gorgeous, golden brown and moist. This would be delicious with nuts and chocolate chips. Goes great w hot tea!
Everything you could expect from a good banana bread. Moist, flavorful, satisfying. I added chocolate chips and walnuts for some variation. Definitely going to be my go-to recipe!

I’ve tried many recipes for banana bread before and this one was the best. My entire family loved it. My kids keep asking me for more. I followed the recipe exactly as it is. However instead of smashing the bananas with a fork I used a hand blender. Best banana bread recipe ever!!! Thank you!

YUM! I made these into muffins. Baked for 20-25min. These are my new favorite. I did read some of the reviews, reduced the sugar to 1/2 cup and added 1/8 tsp of salt nd 1/2 tsp of vanilla. I also addded a sprinkle of chocolate chips on top. 

As long as you mix the dry ingrediants well in a seperate bowl then the wet in another and only mix them together enough to moisten they turn out perfect. 

Mix too much and they get chewy. I can't wait to try these with added coconut and pineapple.

Excellent recipe !!
I had added an extra 1/2 c of flour and the batter went a little dry at first..
So I added another quarter of sugar free applesauce and about a 1/4 c. Of hazelnut coffee creamer to get the batter to pour smooth...
Turned out nicely, I may add some walnuts next time..
Five thumbs up on a great recipe..

As others suggested I added the nutmeg, used whole eggs (I tripled the recipe) and put brown sugar on top. I set the time at the lessor setting of 50 minutes and was very glad I did, it was ready to come out then. This recipe is a little less sweet than I personally like but I like it on the sweet side. I did not decrease the sugar due to my personal preference. The brown sugar on top adds a very nice crunch and is very pleasing to the eye. My grandson didn’t even let it cool before he cut out a large hunk! It is good!
Made it with slight changes. I added 1tsp of vanilla, as other reviews said. I also didn’t see that it was 2 egg WHITES, thought just eggs. So I ended up just using one whole egg. Turned out great.

A very tasty bread or muffin! I believe it is a good basic recipe that can be tweaked with other ingredients, such as raisins. I also used apple butter when I had no applesauce. A great recipe for those who can not have fat!

The only things I did differently were to add 1/2 tsp vanilla, and I mixed the wet and dry separately first. otherwise this was great. I have been watching my fat intake since getting gallstones and this was a very welcome treat!

Following the suggestions of others I used 1/2 c brown sugar, one whole egg instead of 2 whites, 6 bananas instead of 2 and 1/3 cup applesauce. Added 1tsp vanilla extract and 1tsp almond extract, 1/2 tsp nutmeg, 1/4 tsp. salt and 1/4 c chopped walnuts.

4 stars because not quite as good as a recipe that is not low fat! I did as suggested in several reviews: added 1/2 tsp salt, 1/3 cup applesauce, almost 3/4 sugar, 1 egg instead of 2 egg whites, 1 tsp vanilla; baked as muffins only 15 minutes at 350 degrees. Made for my sister-in-law who has to maintain a low fat, low sugar diet. She thought they were great!
No changes made

It was very moist. I did substitute the white sugar for brown sugar, and I only had a mixed, homemade rhubarb-applesauce. Next time I will put a little foil over the top the last 15 min. to avoid over-browning. I will definitely make it again.
Followed the recipe exactly - delicious and moist. My husband and I absolutely loved it!
We loved this bread, but it needed a little less cook time and a little more cinnamon.

Bless it!! (4.5) Heres what I did differently from the recipe/added & it turned out amazing: half whole wheat flour & half all-purpose, one whole egg, 1/2 tsp nutmeg, 1/8th tsp salt, and 2 tsp vanilla extract. I also separated the wet & dry ingredients until final mixing

This recipe is just right, I have cut the suger to 1/2 cup, but I belive if you like to add whole nut you need to stick to the mentioned measurement of sugar, I made the apple sauce my self and It turned out fabulous, I used three medium sized bananas, I have whisked the eggs white,and the recipe took 50 min. Using electric oven. I loved the recipe and diffently will add it to my favorites but next time I believe I 'll use whole nut.
I have been making this recipe for years and it comes out perfect every time. I add 1/2 tsp of vanilla and that is all. If I make mini muffins for the kids, I put them in for about 20-22 minutes!
Added peanut butter

I will make again, it was moist, fluffy/springy. Doubled recipe. Added 1/2 tsp salt, and used 2 whole eggs (I added a dab of butter - haha). With ~half batter, made 12 muffins and cooked for about 18 minutes. The other part, I put it in a loaf pan and cooked it about 55 minutes.

With some tweaks, it came out AMAZING! I've got people begging me for my recipe! I followed the advice of some other users and changed the recipe a little: I used 1/2 cup sugar, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1/4 tsp salt, one whole egg instead of 2 whites, 3 bananas instead of two and 1/2 cup plain Greek yogurt instead of applesauce - everything else was as is.

I’m not sure if I’m just used to the full fat recipes I’ve always done but this wasn’t good! I had two bites and realized it wasn’t worth saving the rest. I took notes and followed what others did to add flavor. To prevent it from being rubbery I folded in the ingredients versus a mixer but was still on the tougher side. Not making this again. I’m super bummed!

I've tried several low/no fat banana bread recipes and this one is by far the best. I added Craisins, probably more than I should but it's still yummy! to cut down the fat even more, I sprayed my pan instead of "lightly greasing". I'll definitely be using this recipe in the future!

I read the reviews and used less sugar and more apple sauce. I also added some nutmeg and a little vanilla. I like that this recipe has some versatility. The bread turned out delicious! I topped it with some slivered almonds. I highly recommend this recipe.

I read the reviews and used less sugar and more apple sauce. I also added some nutmeg and a little vanilla. I like that this recipe has some versatility. The bread turned out delicious! I topped it with some slivered almonds. I highly recommend this recipe.

I love this recipe! Made delicious, sweet, moist bread :) I did make a few changes. To make the recipe vegan I replaced the egg whites with 1/4 cup of dark chocolate almond milk (I also just wanted to add a bit of chocolatey goodness!) and I doubled the cinnamon because I love cinnamon. Very happy with the results.
Loved it!!
I’ve made This recipe a few times and every time it’s great. I’ve done it in the form of waffles, I’ve done it in bread and Muffins.
This recipe is perfect!
I used a tiny bit less sugar, another banana for some chunks, added raisins and a 4th of a teaspoon of ginger.
Added 1 tsp olive oil, used 1 whole egg, whipped liquid ingredients before adding to dry

Followed the suggestions by Snapplemeblue. Overall, this was a solid banana bread recipe considering how much healthier it was than traditional recipes. There was a slight hint of flavor being off - I think maybe a pinch of salt would help. I also had to bake mine much longer than 55 minutes - maybe a reflection of all of the changes I made? It was probably closer to 1:05-1:10. I would definitely make this again.

The only change I made to this recipe was using Stevia instead of regular sugar. The bread was very good. I was happy to find this recipe to make for my mom who is on a medically required no salt, no fat diet. She & my dad are enjoying this bread.

This bread was so simple that I was surprised at the flavor and moistness! It was very tasty and didn't last long. Even my picky eater granddaughter loved it! The only change I made was to add pecans. Yummy!
Great
It's only been out for a little while. So all I can say is that it's OK when warm. My family seemed to enjoy it though, so I might just have to update this later on.

Will definitely make this again! I followed the advice of a few other reviewers and made the following changes:

3 bananas instead of 2, added 1/8 tsp salt, used 1/4 cup sugar and 1/4 cup stevia, added 1/2 tsp nutmeg, 1/2 tsp cinnamon, used 1 whole egg instead of 2 egg whites, upped applesauce to 1/3 cup, added 1/2 tsp vanilla extract and 1/2 tsp almond extract.

Sooooo good! Can't wait for a few of the next batch of bananas to go past their prime!
I used one egg rather than two egg whites and increased the applesauce to one third cup and added a cup of raisins. Every one absolutely loves this Banana Bread.
It was okay but a little rubbery
I used gluten free flour! Very good!

My wife is allergic to apples, so I used a pureed pear, turned out very moist, I would have never known there wasn't butter in this recipe. As a bonus, it was super easy to make, as a rookie, I had the batter mixed before the oven was ready.
I used 1/2 cup sugar, 1 egg instead of 2 egg whites, added chocolate chips, salt, nutmeg, vanilla, and almond extract. It tasted too healthy for my liking.

Made it today by doubling the recipe and the kids almost ate the whole first loaf. Here were my modifications: 1/2 cup of sugar, added 1tsp vanilla and 1/2 tsp nutmeg and substituted 1/3 of the flour with whole wheat flour. Next time I may add a bit of chocolate chips. It was moist and delicious!
Excellent!
Very delicious. Great flavor. A little too sweet.

I can't give it 5 stars because the recipe is missing some details. Don't forget 1/2 tsp salt. Mix the dry ingredients nd the wet ingredients (incl. sugr) seperatlely then stir the wet into the dry until just combined. I cut the sugr down to 1 cup; I also used 1 egg instead of 2 whites but that was just because I didn't want to waste an egg. I don't believe these changes had great overall effect on the quality of the cake. 

The result was delicious.
Good, healthy banana bread option! Added chocolate chips for fun (and a little bit of indulgence) and it worked well. Kids ate it all up! Thanks for a keeper!
Rubbery. Tastes good but texture is killing my craving...
Doubled applesauce, added nutmeg and walnuts, and I also reduced the sugar to half cup. It makes a moist, dense banana bread, which is my favorite kind. I love this recipe!
Followed the recipe but only used 1/2 cup of sugar and added pumkin seeds it tasted divine.
It was a little bit too spongy on the crust . But the flavour was really nice.

Turned out moist! I only used 1 tablespoon of organic coconut sugar, half white & half whole wheat flour, upped baking powder by 1/4 teaspoon, added salt, nutmeg & vanilla. I mixed in goji berries, walnuts and chia seed for added superfood nutrition.

I combined suggestions from several others: 1/2 c sugar, four very ripe bananas (small-med size), pumpkin spice + cinnamon, 1/3 c apple sauce, 1 whole egg, 1tsp vanilla, replaced half c flour with white unbleached whole wheat, 1/4 tsp salt, had no baking soda so I replaced with extra 1/2 tsp baking powder, added a lovely brown sugar chia seed topping (a little water added to make it a nice drizzle), AND my own addition: one grated zucchini from the garden :D 
Overall great texture great flavor, no complaints!
I replaced the sugar with about a quarter cup of raw honey. Worked great and my kids loved it.

My husband loves banana bread. I didn't tell him that this was a low fat recipe. He loved it! Even better than my regular recipe.
Sharing the recipe now with my daughter-in-law, sister-in-law and niece. 
Will be waiting for their opinions.

I love this banana bread! I have made it exactly as the recipe states and then I have made modifications - added chocolate chips or a dash of nutmeg or vanilla - no matter how I make it everyone loves it! This is now my go-to recipe for banana bread!

All in all I rate this as okay for a non-fat banana bread. I made the recipe exactly as stated. Having read the other reviews which said it was dry, I shortened the baking time to 45 min. and didn't find it was dry that way. A split on taste though. I thought it tasted pretty good and like the no fat idea, just wish it was no calories as well. My husband said it was ' only okay' and that something was missing.

I have made a vegan version of this (using a flax egg and some extra baking powder). I also made it into a pumpkin bread, which was delicious. Apple sauce isn't so widely available in the UK so I subbed some soy yoghurt and I cut the sugar to a half a cup (also I only had brown sugar, which gives it a lovely molasses flavour). It wasn't gummy or tough and honestly it didn't even last 24 hours on the counter! I now use this recipe as a base for different loaves (I've also made some yoghurt-lemon chia cake!)

I was very pleased with this bread. I exchanged the two egg whites for one whole egg (I cannot justify tossing the most nutritious part of the egg away!). As per a few other reviewers, I added nutmeg, salt and 3 bananas. Though it isn't quite as low fat as the original recipe, it is still acceptable and delicious!

I've made this bread from this recipe several times now and it always turns out perfectly. I read the reviews and I followed some of the suggestions which were to increase the amount of banana, add 1 egg instead of 2 egg whites, cut the sugar and half, used a third cup of unsweetened applesauce, added vanilla and also some walnuts. The bread is very moist and flavorful and not at all rubbery as some have reviewed. I think the trick is to not over mix the batter.

I have made this many times in the last few weeks. It's saved me during a difficult time of not being able to eat fat. The only change I made at first was to use half whole wheat flour. Today I substituted a grated apple and one banana for the cup of banana and applesauce. The batter looked a bit dry so I added a couple tablespoons of applesauce as well. Brown sugar and cinnamon on top. Extra yummy!
This was great! I added salt, vanilla, cinnamon, and walnuts. Very yummy. And healthy!

I had a hand of very brown bananas to use up so I doubled the batch & made two loaves today. I am disappointed overall - shoulda stuck with Nana's Full-o-fat Recipe. I used homemade applesauce and followed everything else to the letter. I ended up having to cover w/ foil half-way through and they still got darker than my usual bread. My son and I taste-tested while they were slightly warm and fresh - the bread is super dense, still moist but rubbery texture almost, and lacks flavor. I've enjoyed a dozen BB recipes more than this one - but this one is easy to put together quickly and will be fine for breakfast when we don't want something overly sweet.
Amazing AMAZING AmmAaZziiiiNnG!!
